column1: And outside before the palace a great garden was walled round
column7: which bore the whole year round. For the rich south-west wind fed them
column8: till pear grew ripe on pear
column11: all the winter and the spring. And at the farther end gay flower-beds bloomed through all seasons of the year; and two fair fountains rose
column14: and one beneath the palace gate
column15: to water all the town. Such noble gifts the heavens had given to Alcinous the wise.So they went in
column19: with his golden sceptre by him
column21: and in his hand a sculptured goblet
column22: as he pledged the merchant kings; and beside him stood Arete
column24: and leaned against a pillar as she spun her golden threads.
